memberdef.name: mLoaderCallback

detaileddescription.para: Called when the activity is first created.
Default screen margins, per the Android Design guidelines.
Customize dimensions originally defined in res/values/dimens.xml (such as screen margins) for sw720dp devices (e.g. 10" tablets) in landscape here.
Used for debug logs.
Store the model matrix. This matrix is used to move models from object space (where each model can be thought of being located at the center of the universe) to world space.
Store the view matrix. This can be thought of as our camera. This matrix transforms world space to eye space; it positions things relative to our eye.
Store the projection matrix. This is used to project the scene onto a 2D viewport.
Allocate storage for the final combined matrix. This will be passed into the shader program.
Stores a copy of the model matrix specifically for the light position.
Store our model data in a float buffer.
This will be used to pass in the transformation matrix.
This will be used to pass in the modelview matrix.
This will be used to pass in the light position.
This will be used to pass in model position information.
This will be used to pass in model color information.
This will be used to pass in model normal information.
How many bytes per float.
Size of the position data in elements.
Size of the color data in elements.
Size of the normal data in elements.
Used to hold a light centered on the origin in model space. We need a 4th coordinate so we can get translations to work when we multiply this by our transformation matrices.
Used to hold the current position of the light in world space (after transformation via model matrix).
Used to hold the transformed position of the light in eye space (after transformation via modelview matrix)
This is a handle to our per-vertex cube shading program.
This is a handle to our light point program.
Initialize the model data.
Draws a cube.
Draws a point representing the position of the light.
Helper function to compile a shader.

simplesect.para: An OpenGL handle to the shader.

memberdef.argsstring: (final int vertexShaderHandle, final int fragmentShaderHandle, final String[] attributes)
memberdef.name: createAndLinkProgram

detaileddescription.para: Helper function to compile and link a program.

parameterdescription.para: An OpenGL handle to an already-compiled vertex shader.
An OpenGL handle to an already-compiled fragment shader.
Attributes that need to be bound to the program.

simplesect.para: An OpenGL handle to the program.

detaileddescription.para: This class implements our custom renderer. Note that the GL10 parameter passed in is unused for OpenGL ES 2.0 renderers the static class GLES20 is used instead.

memberdef.name: fragmentShaderCode
memberdef.initializer: = "precision mediump float;" + "uniform vec4 vColor;" + "void main() {" + " gl_FragColor = vColor;" + "}"

detaileddescription.para: Returns the rotation angle of the triangle shape (mTriangle).

simplesect.para: - A float representing the rotation angle.

detaileddescription.para: Sets the rotation angle of the triangle shape (mTriangle).
Sets the scale ratio of the triangle shape (mTriangle).
Sets the translate position of the triangle shape(mTriangle).
Utility method for compiling a OpenGL shader.
Note: When developing shaders, use the checkGlError() method to debug shader coding errors.

simplesect.para: - Returns an id for the shader.

detaileddescription.para: Utility method for debugging OpenGL calls. Provide the name of the call just after making it:
If the operation is not successful, the check throws an error.

listitem.para: Name of the OpenGL call to check.

detaileddescription.para:
Provides drawing instructions for a GLSurfaceView object. This class must override the OpenGL ES drawing lifecycle methods:
android.opengl.GLSurfaceView.Renderer#onSurfaceCreated
android.opengl.GLSurfaceView.Renderer#onDrawFrame
android.opengl.GLSurfaceView.Renderer#onSurfaceChanged
A view container where OpenGL ES graphics can be drawn on screen. This view can also be used to capture touch events, such as a user interacting with drawn objects.

memberdef.name: mLoaderCallback
vertexShaderCode
memberdef.initializer:
=
"uniform mat4 uMVPMatrix;" + "attribute vec4 vPosition;" + "void main() {" +
" gl_Position = uMVPMatrix * vPosition;" + "}"

memberdef.name: fragmentShaderCode
memberdef.initializer: = "precision mediump float;" + "uniform vec4 vColor;" + "void main() {" + " gl_FragColor = vColor;" + "}"

detaileddescription.para: Sets up the drawing object data for use in an OpenGL ES context.
Encapsulates the OpenGL ES instructions for drawing this shape.

parameterdescription.para: - The Model View Project matrix in which to draw this shape.

detaileddescription.para: A two-dimensional square for use as a drawn object in OpenGL ES 2.0.
Base application theme for API 11+. This theme completely replaces AppBaseTheme from res/values/styles.xml on API 11+ devices.

API 11 theme customizations can go here. Base application theme for API 14+. This theme completely replaces AppBaseTheme from BOTH res/values/styles.xml and res/values-v11/styles.xml on API 14+ devices.
API 14 theme customizations can go here.

memberdef.name: vertexShaderCode
memberdef.initializer:
=
"uniform mat4 uMVPMatrix;" + "attribute vec4 vPosition;" + "void main() {" +
" gl_Position = uMVPMatrix * vPosition;" + "}"

memberdef.name: fragmentShaderCode
memberdef.initializer: = "precision mediump float;" + "uniform vec4 vColor;" + "void main() {" + " gl_FragColor = vColor;" + "}"

detaileddescription.para: Sets up the drawing object data for use in an OpenGL ES context.
Encapsulates the OpenGL ES instructions for drawing this shape.
